bitmark:
[.book]
[@id:218338]
[@externalId:e-stze-wortstellung_5mxg6w7fwt12]
[#Sätze, Wortstellung]
[@language:de]
[@coverImage:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/englisch-hilfen/web-resources/images/englischhilfen_grammatik_cover.png]

[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218339]
[%Nr. 3338]
[!Schreibe die Sätze als Fragen und umgekehrt. Beachte das Beispiel.]

0. It is a nice day.
[_Is it a nice day][@example]?
1. She is from Glasgow.
[_Is she from Glasgow]?
2. Are we in a team?
[_We are in a team].
3. They play volleyball.
[_Do they play volleyball]?
4. Does she go to school?
[_She goes to school].
5. I have your phone number.
[_Do I have your phone number]?
6. Do they repair cars?
[_They repair cars].
7. You are old.
[_Are you old]?
8. Do you understand English?
[_You understand English.].
9. Is Henry his uncle?
[_Henry is his uncle].
10. I am his friend.
[_Am I his friend]?

bit.body:
0. It is a nice day.
{0}?
1. She is from Glasgow.
{1}?
2. Are we in a team?
{2}.
3. They play volleyball.
{3}?
4. Does she go to school?
{4}.
5. I have your phone number.
{5}?
6. Do they repair cars?
{6}.
7. You are old.
{7}?
8. Do you understand English?
{8}.
9. Is Henry his uncle?
{9}.
10. I am his friend.
{10}?
bit.instruction: Schreibe die Sätze als Fragen und umgekehrt. Beachte das Beispiel.

solutions: Is it a nice day
Is she from Glasgow
We are in a team
Do they play volleyball
She goes to school
Do I have your phone number
They repair cars
Are you old
You understand English.
Henry is his uncle
Am I his friend

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:218340]
[%Nr. 3326]
[!Welche der beiden Konjunktionen/Bindewörter passt in die jeweilige Lücke?]

1. I like English [+and][-but] I like French very much.
2. My brother likes maths [-and][+but] he doesn't like history.
3. The children forgot their homework, [-or][+so] the teacher was angry with them.
4. Can you read [+and][-but] write English words?
5. Are the questions right [-and][+or] wrong?
6. It's great [+and][-but] it's fun.
7. Would you like tea [-but][+or] hot chocolate for your breakfast?
8. Our car is old, [+but][-so] it drives beautifully.
9. It was very warm, [-or][+so] we all went swimming.
10. Do we have French [-but][+or] music after the break?

bit.body:
1. I like English {0} I like French very much.
2. My brother likes maths {1} he doesn't like history.
3. The children forgot their homework, {2} the teacher was angry with them.
4. Can you read {3} write English words?
5. Are the questions right {4} wrong?
6. It's great {5} it's fun.
7. Would you like tea {6} hot chocolate for your breakfast?
8. Our car is old, {7} it drives beautifully.
9. It was very warm, {8} we all went swimming.
10. Do we have French {9} music after the break?
bit.instruction: Welche der beiden Konjunktionen/Bindewörter passt in die jeweilige Lücke?

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:218341]
[%Nr. 3334]
[!Welche der vorgegebenen Konjunktionen/Bindewörter passt am besten in die jeweilige Lücke?]

1. I like sugar in my tea, [-and][+but][-or][-so] I don't like milk in it.
2. Listen to the story [+and][-because][-but][-or] answer the questions in complete sentences.
3. Is it Thursday [-and][-but][+or][-then] Friday today?
4. He was late [-although][+because][-but][-or] the bus didn't come.
5. We were very tired [-and][+but][-or][-so] happy after our flight to Sydney.
6. They climbed the mountain [+although][-or][-nor][-so] it was very windy.
7. [-And][-But][-So][+While] Lenny was watching the planes his wife was reading in the car.
8. I'll text you [+after][-or][-so][-then] I have arrived in Toronto.
9. Neither my brother [-and][-but][+nor][-so] my sister own a car.
10. The sun was warm, [-after][-nor][-so][+yet] the wind was a bit too cool.

bit.body:
1. I like sugar in my tea, {0} I don't like milk in it.
2. Listen to the story {1} answer the questions in complete sentences.
3. Is it Thursday {2} Friday today?
4. He was late {3} the bus didn't come.
5. We were very tired {4} happy after our flight to Sydney.
6. They climbed the mountain {5} it was very windy.
7. {6} Lenny was watching the planes his wife was reading in the car.
8. I'll text you {7} I have arrived in Toronto.
9. Neither my brother {8} my sister own a car.
10. The sun was warm, {9} the wind was a bit too cool.
bit.instruction: Welche der vorgegebenen Konjunktionen/Bindewörter passt am besten in die jeweilige Lücke?

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:218342]
[%Nr. 3336]
[!Welche der beiden Konjunktionen/Bindewörter passt in die jeweilige Lücke?]

1. On Sundays I often stay in bed [-before][+until] 10 o'clock.
2. [+After][-While] John has done his homework, he may play his favourite computer game.
3. We were on our way to Ashville [+when][-while] our car broke down.
4. [-After][+Before] I go to school, I take my little brother to preschool.
5. I'll phone you [-until][+when] I'm there.
6. It's still two days [-after][+before] our son flies back to Chicago.
7. [+After][-Until] I finished school, I went to New Zealand.
8. We had left the beach [+before][-until] the rain started.
9. We stayed in our house [-before[+until] the rain stopped.
10. [+When][-While] he heard about the accident he was shocked.

bit.body:
1. On Sundays I often stay in bed {0} 10 o'clock.
2. {1} John has done his homework, he may play his favourite computer game.
3. We were on our way to Ashville {2} our car broke down.
4. {3} I go to school, I take my little brother to preschool.
5. I'll phone you {4} I'm there.
6. It's still two days {5} our son flies back to Chicago.
7. {6} I finished school, I went to New Zealand.
8. We had left the beach {7} the rain started.
9. We stayed in our house [-before[+until] the rain stopped.
10. {9} he heard about the accident he was shocked.
bit.instruction: Welche der beiden Konjunktionen/Bindewörter passt in die jeweilige Lücke?

errors.errorLine: 9. We stayed in our house [-before[+until] the rain stopped.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218344]
[%3324]
[!Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern jeweils einen Aussagesatz.]

1. play / they / handball / in the evening / always
[_They always play handball in the evening].
2. in Berlin / can / his uncle / he / visit
[_He can visit his uncle in Berlin].
3. she / writes / a letter / often
[_She often writes a letter].
4. often / it / in Scotland / rains
[_It often rains in Scotland].
5. lunch / did / we / not / yesterday / have / at school
[_We did not have lunch at school yesterday].
6. he / speaks / well / French
[_He speaks French well].
7. did / I / my homework / do / in my room / not
[_I did not do my homework in my room].
8. to music / Marlen / is listening / now
[_Marlen is listening to music now].
9. Victoria Station / leaves / the bus / at 7 o'clock
[_The bus leaves Victoria Station at 7 o'clock].
10. Alex / in the shower / the song / sang / loudly
[_Alex sang the song loudly in the shower].

bit.body:
1. play / they / handball / in the evening / always
{0}.
2. in Berlin / can / his uncle / he / visit
{1}.
3. she / writes / a letter / often
{2}.
4. often / it / in Scotland / rains
{3}.
5. lunch / did / we / not / yesterday / have / at school
{4}.
6. he / speaks / well / French
{5}.
7. did / I / my homework / do / in my room / not
{6}.
8. to music / Marlen / is listening / now
{7}.
9. Victoria Station / leaves / the bus / at 7 o'clock
{8}.
10. Alex / in the shower / the song / sang / loudly
{9}.
bit.instruction: Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern jeweils einen Aussagesatz.

solutions: They always play handball in the evening
He can visit his uncle in Berlin
She often writes a letter
It often rains in Scotland
We did not have lunch at school yesterday
He speaks French well
I did not do my homework in my room
Marlen is listening to music now
The bus leaves Victoria Station at 7 o'clock
Alex sang the song loudly in the shower

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218345]
[%3324]
[!Schreibe den Satz noch einmal mit dem in Klammern stehenden Wort/Wörtern.]

1. We have met him.
[_We have met him before][!before].
2. Did you see Mr Fisher?
[_Did you see Mr Fisher yesterday morning][!yesterday morning]?
3. She goes to school by bus.
[_She always goes to school by bus][!always].
4. We watched the film.
[_We watched the film last weekend][!last weekend].
5. They are flying.
[_They are flying to Rome on Tuesday][!to Rome / on Tuesday].
6. Rita speaks English.
[_Rita speaks English fluently][!fluently].
7. He is late.
[_He is never late][!never].
8. The boy ran out of the room.
[_The boy quickly ran out of the room][!quickly].
9. Have you been to Canada?
[_Have you ever been to Canada][!ever]?
10. The cat is playing.
[_The cat is playing in the garden][!in the garden].

bit.body:
1. We have met him.
{0}.
2. Did you see Mr Fisher?
{1}?
3. She goes to school by bus.
{2}.
4. We watched the film.
{3}.
5. They are flying.
{4}.
6. Rita speaks English.
{5}.
7. He is late.
{6}.
8. The boy ran out of the room.
{7}.
9. Have you been to Canada?
{8}?
10. The cat is playing.
{9}.
bit.instruction: Schreibe den Satz noch einmal mit dem in Klammern stehenden Wort/Wörtern.

solutions: We have met him before
Did you see Mr Fisher yesterday morning
She always goes to school by bus
We watched the film last weekend
They are flying to Rome on Tuesday
Rita speaks English fluently
He is never late
The boy quickly ran out of the room
Have you ever been to Canada
The cat is playing in the garden

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice:bitmark--]
[@id:218346]
[%3324]
[!Welcher Sätze sind richtig?]
===
[!1. Welche Aussage stimmt?]
[-My friend gave a book to me.]
[-My friend gave me a book.]
[+Beide Sätze sind richtig.]
===
[!2. Welche Aussage stimmt?]
[-I watched TV yesterday evening.]
[-Yesterday evening I watched TV.]
[+Beide Sätze sind richtig.]
===
[!3. Welche Aussage stimmt?]
[-Where are you?]
[-Who are you?]
[+Beide Fragen sind richtig.]
===
[!4. Welche Aussage stimmt?]
[+Judy often reads magazines.]
[-Judy reads often magazines.]
[-Beide Sätze sind richtig.]
===
[!5. Welche Aussage stimmt?]
[-Every Friday they play hockey in the stadium.]
[-They play hockey in the stadium every Friday.]
[+Beide Sätze sind richtig.]
===
[!6. Welche Aussage stimmt?]
[+She always arrives late in the morning.]
[-She arrives always late in the morning.]
[-Beide Sätze sind richtig.]
===
[!7. Welche Aussage stimmt?]
[+Last Wednesday we saw a film.]
[-We saw last Wednesday a film.]
[-Beide Sätze sind richtig.]
===
[!8. Welche Aussage stimmt?]
[-He's going to buy a present to give to his sister.]
[-He's going to buy his sister a present.]
[+Beide Sätze sind richtig.]
===
[!9. Welche Aussage stimmt?]
[-For who are you waiting?]
[+Who are you waiting for?]
[-Beide Sätze sind richtig.]
===
[!10. Welche Aussage stimmt?]
[-From where are you?]
[+Where are you from?]
[-Beide Fragen sind richtig.]
===

bit.instruction: Welcher Sätze sind richtig?

choices.choice: My friend gave a book to me.
My friend gave me a book.
Every Friday they play hockey in the stadium.
They play hockey in the stadium every Friday.
She always arrives late in the morning.
She arrives always late in the morning.
Last Wednesday we saw a film.
We saw last Wednesday a film.
He's going to buy a present to give to his sister.
He's going to buy his sister a present.

[-Ortsangabe]
[-Subjekt]

quizzes.instruction: 2. Every Friday he goes to the club.
8. Emma often arrives late at school.

bitmark:
[.interview:bitmark--]
[@id:218364]
[%Nr. 3324]
[!Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern jeweils einen Aussagesatz.]
===
[%1]when / do / get up / you / in the morning
[$When do you get up in the morning?]
===
[%2]like / do / they / cola
[$Do they like cola?]
===
[%3]where / has / bought / John / his car
[$Where has John bought his car?]
===
[%4]why / James / so tired / is
[$Why is James so tired?]
===
[%5]Kaito and Sakura / from Tokyo / are
[$Are Kaito and Sakura from Tokyo?]
===
[%6]How / your grandmother / is
[$How is your grandmother?]
===
[%7]who / the window / broke
[$Who broke the window?]
===
[%8]the girls / text messages / are / writing
[$Are the girls writing text messages?]
===
[%9]what / Angela / like / for breakfast / does
[$What does Angela like for breakfast?]
===
[%10]you / your homework / have / done / yet
[$Have you done your homework yet?]
===

bit.instruction: Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern jeweils einen Aussagesatz.

questions.question: when / do / get up / you / in the morning
questions.sampleSolution: When do you get up in the morning?

questions.question: where / has / bought / John / his car
questions.sampleSolution: Where has John bought his car?

questions.question: Kaito and Sakura / from Tokyo / are
questions.sampleSolution: Are Kaito and Sakura from Tokyo?

questions.question: the girls / text messages / are / writing
questions.sampleSolution: Are the girls writing text messages?

questions.question: what / Angela / like / for breakfast / does
questions.sampleSolution: What does Angela like for breakfast?

questions.question: you / your homework / have / done / yet
questions.sampleSolution: Have you done your homework yet?

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218348]
[%Nr. 3346]
[!Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern oder Wortgruppen **sinnvolle Aussagesätze**. Klick dazu auf die Wörter oder Wortgruppen.]

0. to the office / they / walked / yesterday
[_They walked to the office yesterday.][@example]
1. started / at 3.30 pm / the match
[_The match started at 3.30 pm].
2. great / were / our holidays
[_Our holidays were great].
3. flew / last month / to India / his family
[_His family flew to India last month].
4. my sister / with Gerry / had / dinner
[_My sister had dinner with Gerry].
5. yesterday afternoon / his friends / Jack / texted
[_Jack texted his friends yesterday afternoon].
6. they / Greece / visited / two weeks ago
[_They visited Greece two weeks ago].
7. last Saturday / we / met/  at a concert / Tim
[_We met Tim at a concert last Saturday].
8. the children / went swimming / yesterday
[_The children went swimming yesterday].
9. an hour ago / my aunt / in Canada / called / I
[_I called my aunt in Canada an hour ago].
10. photos / Lisa / took / with her smartphone
[_Lisa took photos with her smartphone].

bit.body:
0. to the office / they / walked / yesterday
{0}
1. started / at 3.30 pm / the match
{1}.
2. great / were / our holidays
{2}.
3. flew / last month / to India / his family
{3}.
4. my sister / with Gerry / had / dinner
{4}.
5. yesterday afternoon / his friends / Jack / texted
{5}.
6. they / Greece / visited / two weeks ago
{6}.
7. last Saturday / we / met/  at a concert / Tim
{7}.
8. the children / went swimming / yesterday
{8}.
9. an hour ago / my aunt / in Canada / called / I
{9}.
10. photos / Lisa / took / with her smartphone
{10}.
bit.instruction: Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern oder Wortgruppen **sinnvolle Aussagesätze**. Klick dazu auf die Wörter oder Wortgruppen.

solutions: They walked to the office yesterday.
The match started at 3.30 pm
Our holidays were great
His family flew to India last month
My sister had dinner with Gerry
Jack texted his friends yesterday afternoon
They visited Greece two weeks ago
We met Tim at a concert last Saturday
The children went swimming yesterday
I called my aunt in Canada an hour ago
Lisa took photos with her smartphone

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218349]
[%Nr. 3350]
[!Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern oder Wortgruppen **sinnvolle Aussagesätze**. Klick dazu auf die Wörter oder Wortgruppen. Achte auf Verneinungen.]

0. in the library / didn't / Sophie / work / yesterday
[_Sophie didn't work in the library yesterday.][@example]
1. Lenny / forget / yesterday / the homework / didn't
[_Lenny didn't forget the homework yesterday].
2. saw / four days ago / I / in the shop / my brother
[_I saw my brother in the shop four days ago].
3. go / didn't / last Saturday / by train / she / to Paris
[_She didn't go to Paris by train last Saturday].
4. the weather / at the weekend / wasn't / nice
[_The weather wasn't nice at the weekend].
5. in Wales / two weeks ago / were / not / they
[_They were not in Wales two weeks ago].
6. we / last month / to London / went
[_We went to London last month].
7. yesterday / lunch / Dustin / had / in the office
[_Dustin had lunch in the office yesterday].
8. walk / my parents / three days ago / didn't / to the museum
[_My parents didn't walk to the museum three days ago].
9. the bathroom / last Monday / Steve / cleaned
[_Steve cleaned the bathroom last Monday].
10. didn't / make / a chocolate cake / she / this morning
[_She didn't make a chocolate cake this morning].

bit.body:
0. in the library / didn't / Sophie / work / yesterday
{0}
1. Lenny / forget / yesterday / the homework / didn't
{1}.
2. saw / four days ago / I / in the shop / my brother
{2}.
3. go / didn't / last Saturday / by train / she / to Paris
{3}.
4. the weather / at the weekend / wasn't / nice
{4}.
5. in Wales / two weeks ago / were / not / they
{5}.
6. we / last month / to London / went
{6}.
7. yesterday / lunch / Dustin / had / in the office
{7}.
8. walk / my parents / three days ago / didn't / to the museum
{8}.
9. the bathroom / last Monday / Steve / cleaned
{9}.
10. didn't / make / a chocolate cake / she / this morning
{10}.
bit.instruction: Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern oder Wortgruppen **sinnvolle Aussagesätze**. Klick dazu auf die Wörter oder Wortgruppen. Achte auf Verneinungen.

solutions: Sophie didn't work in the library yesterday.
Lenny didn't forget the homework yesterday
I saw my brother in the shop four days ago

2. nervous / weren't / during the test / they

[_Tom didn't visit his uncle two days ago].

[_We didn't get up before 9 yesterday].

[_She didn't have ketchup with her burger].

[_The weather wasn't nice this afternoon].

[_I didn't stay at home last weekend].
9. Rick and Nate / didn't stream / the last levels
[_Rick and Nate didn't stream the last levels].
10. didn't go / to school / the children / last Friday
[_The children didn't go to school last Friday].

[!Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern oder Wortgruppen **sinnvolle Aussagesätze**. Klick dazu auf die Wörter oder Wortgruppen.
Setze die **Zeitangabe an das Ende des Satzes**.]

0. read / we / every day / comics
[_We read comics every day.][@example]
1. have / lots of friends / we
[_We have lots of friends].
2. live /I / in High Street
[_I live in High Street].
3. works / at night / Ella
[_Ella works at night].
4. at the supermarket / buys / my mum / sweets
[_My mum buys sweets at the supermarket].
5. they / get up / early in the morning
[_They get up early in the morning].
6. games / she plays / in her room
[_She plays games in her room].
7. on Saturdays / Ryan / works / in the garden
[_Ryan works in the garden on Saturdays].
8. to bed / goes / he / after 9 o'clock
[_He goes to bed after 9 o'clock].
9. makes / every Sunday / dinner / Olivia
[_Olivia makes dinner every Sunday].
10. like / ice cream / I
[_I like ice cream].

[_She seldom goes to the computer lab on Tuesday afternoons].
5. mum and dad / stay / up / not / late / on weekdays / do
[_Mum and dad do not stay up late on weekdays].
6. to the car / the / reporter / is / running
[_The reporter is running to the car].
7. not / play / my / friend / tennis / does
[_My friend does not play tennis].
8. goes / grandmother / skating / never / his
[_His grandmother never goes skating].
9. cannot / hamsters / two / I / see
[_I cannot see two hamsters].
10. kitchen / breakfast / always / the / in / has / Jack
[_Jack always has breakfast in the kitchen].

bit.instruction: Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern oder Wortgruppen **bejahte oder verneinte Aussagesätze**. Klick dazu auf die Wörter oder Wortgruppen.

solutions: The children are not reading books.
He is singing a new song now
I do not like Mondays
Cats do not usually sleep at night
She seldom goes to the computer lab on Tuesday afternoons
Mum and dad do not stay up late on weekdays
The reporter is running to the car
